title: disable "files.insertFinalNewline" and its friends when resolve merge conflict
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

I normally enable `files.insertFinalNewline` for linting reason. But this option will also add a newline into files when you solve merge conflict (for my case, interactive rebase) in VSCode. which in the end will cause another conflict when you pull/push at last stage.

title: Code thinks that there is a new update when changing the system date

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.36
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1903 (OS Build 18362.175)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change your system date to a future date, say the year 2020 or 2021.
2. Start VS Code.
3. Watch the cog icon at the bottom left in VS Code. An icon that looks like a "clock" should appear on the cog. Hover over the cog and it should display a message: "Manage - New Code update available."

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: 1.36 scrolling suddenly laggy - precision touchpads
body:
Since updating to 1.36 the scrolling experience got bad. 
I increased the multiplier to have the same speed, but it still feels "heavy" to scroll, not the same as before - what change could be the cause for this? 

Same in the explorer view (with or without the new guides). 
Here it looks like the renderer skips frames, jumpy and not calm (also the scroll multiplier does not seem to have an effect here, merely Alt). 

I'm using a precision touchpad device (Dell) but this is not the old problem and cannot be solved by resizing the window. 

It is especially annoying in the explorer tree, bordering close to the unusable level. 
After trying for a while I will now downgrade to 1.35.x. This seamingly little handicap somehow greatly impacts productivity, at least for me, feels like having a slow computer. 

**Update**: Yes, 1.35.1 is definitely faster and lighter to scroll (did you add some animation? my setting for 'smooth scrolling' is deactivated). I will have to stay on this version until this is fixed. 

Cannot find anything in the release notes except "This is a major Electron release and comes with Chrome 69 and Node.js 10.11.0 (a major leap forward from our current version with Chrome 66 and Node.js 10.2.0)". I guess it won't be easy to locate the issue. However, the new version is not usable, for me (Windows 10, precision touchpad).

title: User data: migrate Backups, Workspaces, user state into %APPDATA%/User
body:
Today we have a bit of a mix in our `%APPDATA%` folder: a lot of stuff is going into the `%APPDATA%/User` folder but a few things outside are not:
* Backups
* Workspaces
* `storage.json`

I think we should do a migration step for a while to consolidate this data under the `User` folder. 

@Tyriar also happy for your input given you are the author of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3884

title: Weired ctrl+z in "global search from the left panel".
body:
Say I have a file that have been lastly modified.

1. Then, I do a "global search from the left panel".
2. Inside this search panel. I tape or copy/paste some text, and hit ENTER.
3. Then I "edit" the searched terms by doing many Ctrl+z.

Now, why the cursor jump from the search field to the editor, and undo what have been typed in the file? (It does not do so when the file have no changes in the buffer…)

Again, I have noticed this from the beginning… And still annoying me with 1.36.0…

![Peek 2019-07-04 12-12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44751088/60659821-a2f74180-9e56-11e9-9742-c211d34fdaef.gif)

title: Persist view/panel/status view state in settings
body:
Previously, the "Tweet Feedback" status bar item was hidden using the setting `workbench.statusBar.feedback.visible` in `settings.json`. In 1.36 a more general mechanism for hiding status bar items was added. After re-removing "Tweet Feedback" in this version, I was surprised that didn't update `settings.json`.

It looks like those settings are now recorded in `User/globalStorage/state.vscdb` instead. Unfortunately, that file isn't appropriate for source control. I'll have to manually click status bar items to keep or remove on each computer I use Visual Studio Code from, whereas previously that was easy to keep in source control with `settings.json` and share among all computers I use.

title: Integrated terminal with zsh on macOs Catalina starts with incorrect CWD
body:
Using zsh in the integrated terminal on the latest macOs (Catalina) results in a different initial working directory than the one seen in Mojave.

Expected cwd:
```/Users/{user}/project```

Actual cwd:
```/System/Volumes/Data/Users/{user}/project```

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.36.0-insider
- OS Version: macOs 10.15 Beta (Catalina)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a project folder
2. Open integrated terminal with zsh shell
3. Run pwd command

title: VSCode causes Docker Desktop to hang on startup (OSX)
body:
EDIT: On further testing it seems this was occurring when I had a VS Code window opened to my home folder. It may have had a file open in the home directory that was somehow oddly linked to Docker?

---

- VSCode Version: 1.35.1
- OS Version: Mac OSX Mojave 10.14.5

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode
2. Open Docker

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Result:

Docker Desktop hangs on `Docker Desktop is starting...`

Mac OSX console reports (over and over):

```
44;58H                       \^[[44;80H\^[[08;58HThis is the option     \^[[09;58Hone adjusts to change  \^[[10;58Hthe language for the   \^[[11;58Hcurrent system         \^[[12;58H                       \^[[13;58H                       \^[[14;58H                       \^[[15;58H                       \^[[16;58H                       \^[[17;58H                       \^[[18;58H                       \^[[19;58H                       \^[[20;58H                       \^[[21;58H                       \^[[22;58H                       \^[[23;58H                       \^[[24;58H                       \^[[25;58H                       \^[[26;58H                       \^[[27;58H                       \^[[28;58H                       \^[[29;58H                       \^[[30;58H                       \^[[31;58H                       \^[[32;58H                       \^[[33;58H                       \^[[34;58H                       \^[[35;58H                       \^[[36;58H                       \^[[37;58H         <…>
```

```
This is the option one adjusts to change the language for the system <…>
```

I have also seen:

```
This selection will direct the system to continue to booting process
```

Seems like some subsystem in VSCode is trying to send commands to docker as it is booting. Likely needs to wait until it is done to send these commands. Quitting VSCode, starting docker, then reopening VSCode works.

I was debugging this issue on a brand new mac with barely anything installed, then I found this comment:

https://github.com/docker/for-mac/issues/2873#issuecomment-413969899

I have repeatedly tested it, if VS Code is on Docker will not start. Without doing anything but quitting both Docker will start when VS Code is closed.

I do not have any Docker extensions installed for VS Code.

title: Allow to customise IntelliSense font
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Opened as a suggestion from this issue: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/76280#issuecomment-507587535

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I'm using the Iosevka font (https://typeof.net/Iosevka/) as the editor font. The full list of editor fonts is:

```
"Iosevka SS07", "Fira Code", "Source Code Pro", 'Courier New', monospace
```

Since the font was slightly slimmer than my liking, I'd set the editor font family to be **bold**. The UI elements in VSCode are in a non-configurable font (Segoe) which inherit the Editor font weight from settings, but not the font family. This creates peculiar issues on these UI elements which use Segoe instead of the configured editor font.

Some screenshots illustrating the issue:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/760112/60419992-3b49b800-9c04-11e9-91f1-0540fcd78312.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/760112/60322625-8d3cd480-999d-11e9-823c-3bccffbe23c2.png)

My suggestion is to add another setting: `UI font weight` which applies to the UI, and the `Editor font weight` applies to code elements.

title: Horizontal scrolling occurs despite word wrap enabled with GitLens decorations
body:
Issue Type: Bug I pressed the "end" key on my keyboard and was surprised to see the viewport scroll horizontally, as I have word wrap enabled. I do not think I have changed anything in the VSCode configuration recently. Presumably this is a regression in a recent VSCode version, as I have not encountered it before (working on the same files on the same PC). Screenshot of horizontally scrolled viewport after pressing End key on my keyboard: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9914262/60505624-c8584400-9ccc-11e9-8f5a-568908382a12.png) Expected behavior: viewport never scrolls horziontally when word wrap is enabled. Using font Consolas, so should not be related to proportional fonts. title: OUTPUT during debugging not showing
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.35.1 (1.35.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

I'm trying to debug a nodeJS app called strapi. It doesn't work with my database, but that's not the point. It has to be run on a strapi folder like `strapi develop`.

This is what I see in my terminal:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8936090/60486583-400f7a00-9c9f-11e9-9a72-790c75ff708b.png)

When debugging in Webstorm it shows up:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8936090/60486918-92509b00-9c9f-11e9-907e-92b5d305698f.png)

But, using the same debug configuration (program, arguments etc.) nothing shows in VSCode:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8936090/60487257-e8254300-9c9f-11e9-96a6-cdcc3581d446.png)

For a debugging like this, I can't use VSCode. This is my launch config:

```js
{
  // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible attributes.
  // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes.
  // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "configurations": [
    {
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch Program",
      "program": "/usr/local/lib/node_modules/strapi/bin/strapi.js",
      "cwd": "${workspaceFolder}",
      "args": ["develop"],
      "console": "internalConsole",
      "outputCapture": "std"
    }
  ]
}

```

Searching in past issues, I found someone with a similar problem that was solved by using that console and outputCapture settings. I've tried all combinations, and it doesn't work for me.

I've also tried all combinations of breaking in "All exceptions", "Uncaught exceptions"... The debug stops when a thousand other exceptions happen, but not in this error I'm trying to fix. Breakpoints also work but still, can't see the output on the console, so I'm flying blind.

Ideas?

title: Compare merge conflict
body:
When looking at and resolving merge conflicts, you are presented with the option to 'Compare Changes'
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45887246/60472785-14e54600-9c1f-11e9-9290-c090aa04714b.png)

The resulting side-to-side split should allow you to resolve conflict by allowing you to select which side, left (current) or right (incoming) of the conflict you want to keep through the merge.

title: Allow for configuration files in .devcontainer

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Currently I don't seem to know a good way to have container-specific settings, tasks, and launch configurations.

The closest thing to it is to set up settings.json, tasks.json, and launch.json in the workspace .vscode folder, but then it applies to the workspace when you open it normally.

It would be ideal if we could have those same files in the .devcontainer folder and have vscode pick them up from there when the folder is opened in the container.

Currently the closest thing to it is in .devcontainer/devcontainer.json, there is a settings key which is similar to having settings.json, but i don't see anything for tasks or launch.

title: Restart language server – a generic solution

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

body:
Quite often, I encounter a situation where some language server misbehaves and I have to **Reload Window** as the only workaround. I don't like doing that, though, as it also stops all running tasks, restarts terminals, etc.

I know some language servers implement their own "restart language server" command, for example, TypeScript has **Restart TS Server** and there are some third-party feature requests like https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools/issues/1152 or https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/2324 but would there be a way to provide this as a VSCode-wide command that works across extensions?

I can imagine that a new API would need to be proposed that the extensions would need to implement, and I'm not sure how that works, but from the user perspective I'd very much appreciate the feature.

title: Report an error address already in use.
body:
After the shutdown or unscheduled debugging is turned off, “address already in use.” appears.
The machine must be restarted for proper debugging.

title: Issue reporter: investigate to include more GPU information
body:
With Electron 4 we are getting access to a new method [`app.getGPUInfo(type)`](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/4-0-x/docs/api/app.md#appgetgpuinfoinfotype) that seems to provide a lot more GPU related information. I am not sure however if we are reaching the limit of the amount of data we can send to GH.

When I run `app.getGPUInfo('complete')` my output is:

```js

     canSupportThreadedTextureMailbox: false,

      { encrypted_only: false,

        maxResolutionWidth: 4096,
        minResolutionHeight: 16,
        minResolutionWidth: 16,
        profile: 3 },
     videoEncodeAcceleratorSupportedProfile:
      { maxFramerateDenominator: 1,
        maxFramerateNumerator: 30,
        maxResolutionHeight: 2160,
        maxResolutionWidth: 4096,
        profile: 3 } },
  gpuDevice:
   [ { active: true,
       deviceId: 3366,
       deviceString: 'Intel Iris Pro OpenGL Engine',
       driverVendor: 'INTEL',
       driverVersion: '12.9.22',
       vendorId: 32902,
       vendorString: 'Intel Inc.' } ],
  machineModelName: 'MacBookPro',
  machineModelVersion: '11.2' }
```
